arts.ttl: San Diego FC Aiming to Be a "Giant" Club After Beating LAFC for 1st Home Win
arts.sum: Hirving Lozano returned from injury as San Diego FC beat LAFC 3–2 for their first win at Snapdragon Stadium

arts.ttl: San Diego stuns LAFC in thriller as Lozano returns and Lloris falters
arts.sum: San Diego FC hosted LAFC at California’s Snapdragon Stadium and delivered one of the best matches of MLS Matchday 6, pulling off a dramatic 3-2 win thanks to goals from Christopher McVey, Onni Valakari, and Alex Mighten. Odin Holm (63', Cengiz Ünder), William Kumado (63', Franco Negri), Tomás Ángel (63', Alex Mighten), Nathan Ordaz (71', David Martínez), Hirving Lozano (71', Luca de la Torre), Hamady Diop (71', Jasper Löffelsend), Eddie Segura (72', Nkosi Tafari), Ryan Hollingshead (72', Artem Smoliakov), Alejandro Alvarado (81', Aníbal Godoy)

arts.ttl: Christopher McVey sparks big first half as expansion side San Diego holds off LAFC 3-2
arts.sum: McVey used an assist from Anders Dreyer — his first in his sixth career appearance — to score his first goal of the season and give San Diego (3-1-2) the lead. Defender Christopher McVey scored 21 minutes into the match to spark a three-goal first half and expansion side San Diego FC held on to beat Los Angeles FC 3-2 at Snapdragon Stadium on Saturday night.

arts.ttl: 3 Must-Watch MLS Games This Weekend: Inter Miami, Toronto FC, San Diego FC
arts.sum: Lionel Messi is likely to return for Inter Miami, highlighting the must-watch games in another 15-match MLS weekend.
